byline.original: By TOM MASHBERG and GRAHAM BOWLEY

abstract: Destruction of antiquities by Islamic militants has sparked debate among Western museum directors, historians, archaeologists and collectors as to whether disputed artifacts should be repatriated to countries where they may not be safe.
lead_paragraph: As militants ravage artifacts, a debate has resumed over whether Western collectors should return disputed items to their countries of origin.

headline.main: Islamic State Destruction Renews Debate Over Repatriation of Antiquities
headline.print_headline: As ISIS Destroys Treasures, Debate Over Antiquities Renews

snippet: As militants ravage artifacts, a debate has resumed over whether Western collectors should return disputed items to their countries of origin.

keywords.value: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
